weather_report:
In Boston, the afternoon carries with it a palpable chill, the air thick with an impending snowfall that blends seamlessly into the overcast sky. The temperature hangs around a crisp 29 degrees, soon to dip as the day wears on, nudging closer to the frosty 21. Snow showers are likely—a gentle cascade that promises to embrace the city in its white folds, though any accumulation will be modest, perhaps just enough to coat the streets as a reminder of winter's presence. As the clock ticks toward evening, the landscape will darken, with temperatures plunging into the single digits. Winds from the northwest whip through the streets, adding an uninvited chill that may chill skin to the bone, feeling even sharper with the wind's bite.

Today’s atmosphere, though uncomfortable, is also one of quiet beauty; the muted colors of the day invite introspection, perhaps encouraging a slow walk along the snowy paths of the Public Garden or a comforting pause in a cozy café, steam curling from a cup of hot cocoa or coffee. Layered clothing is a must; a warm coat, perhaps knitted gloves snug on your hands, and a soft scarf wrapped twice around your neck would be wise choices. The world outside may be cold and gray, but it offers a unique charm, a reminder of the season's gentle hold. As the snow begins to blanket the sidewalks, consider settling into a good book by the window, or maybe even take the opportunity to build a small snowman, a fleeting joy in the winter’s embrace, as fleeting as the snowflakes themselves.
